description: Indicates that the global error configuration modified successfully.

event.Summary: ISDN global error configuration modified successfully on L1

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnL1MaintenanceControlTimeStamp

description: The threshold for BER 10-3 occurences in 1 second.
BER=Bit Error Rate. BER is a unitless performance measure, expressed as a percentage number.
BER 10-3 means that one bit error is detected in 1000 bits received.
The treshold alarm will raise up if the configured number of occurences was reached during the 1 second intervall.
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnL1Maintenanceber10e3Threshold

description: The threshold for BER 10-6 occurences in 60 second.
BER=Bit Error Rate. BER is a unitless performance measure, expressed as a percentage number.
BER 10-6 means that one bit error is detected in 1000,000 bits received.
The treshold alarm will raise up if the configured number of occurences was reached during the 60 second intervall.
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnL1Maintenanceber10e6Threshold

the entity's network management system to the next re-
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestForceActivatingControlTimeStamp

description: Forced-activation is a test for verifying the layer 1 functionality of the access to the subscriber network after subscriber network installation.
The test will be done in several steps. Firstly, put the layer 1 inactive. Secondly, try to activate the layer 1. Finally, put layer 1 inactive again.
If any step failed, the access layer 1 of the interface is regarded as malfunction. Otherwise, operational.
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestForceActivatingResult

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateChanged SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStatePortTestState i 0 SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStatePortTestModeState i 1 SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateCardTestState i 1 SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateTestModeRemainingTime u 0 SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateLastReqResultState i 0 SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateCurrentTestedPort i 9999 SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateLastInvokedTest i 0

description: The ISDN line test state of this port.
externalTestActive(3) - EXTERNAL TEST MODE has been activated on this port;
the subscriber line has been switched to the external
EXTERNAL TEST MODE may not be activated on any other
Information about the previously run/requested test activities can be found in
sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateLastReqResultState and result object for each test.
1. Only a single port on each IU card can be under test at any one time.
Single ports on different IU cards may be under test at the same time.
Check the sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateCardTestState of the port
to be tested for this pre-requisite. If this pre-requisite is not met,
of the port on the same IU which is currently under test.
2. Additionally only a single port can be configured to EXTERNAL TEST MODE on
the NE at any one time. Ports on other IU cards may be under other tests
to be placed in EXTERNAL TEST MODE for this pre-requisite.
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStatePortTestState

description: Indicates the state of the test mode for this port.
inactive(1) The port is currently not in test mode.
active(2) The port has been placed into test mode.
A port can be optionally placed into 'test mode' that disables the port to allow the
unconditional execution of one or more ISDN line tests.
The test mode state of a port can be activated and deactivate through invocation of the
Test mode can be active on one port of an IU card only.
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStatePortTestModeState

description: The test status of IU card on which this port is located.
Every port reports the state of ISDN line test on the card, on which it is located,
to enable to test whether a ISDN line test request on this port can be accepted.
noTestActivity(1) - no test is running on any port of this IU card;
test mode is not active on any port of this IU card
and can therefore be activated on any port of this
testModeActive(2) - test mode has been activated on one port of this IU
a test may be started on the port reported by
testRunning(3) - a test is currently running on one port of this IU
no test can be started on this IU
Only a single port on each IU card can be under test at any one time.
Ports on different IU cards can be under test at the same time.
Check the corresponding sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateCardTestState of the port
to be tested for this precondition.
If this precondition is not met, parameter sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateCurrentTestedPort
will deliver the ifIndex of the port on the same IU which is currently under test.
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateCardTestState

description: This parameter shows the remaining time the test mode is active on this port.
either test mode has been deactivated or test mode has never been activated,
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateTestModeRemainingTime

description: The result for the last ISDN line test command invoked on the port (copy of
If no ISDN line test command has yet been invoked on the port the value will
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateLastReqResultState

description: This parameter will deliver the ifIndex of the port on the same IU card which
is currently under test (test running or test mode active).
0 - 'no port under test' (no test activity on this IU card).
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateCurrentTestedPort

description: The last test invoked on this port.
See sheIsdnLineTestRequestStatePortTestState for current test state.
none(0) - No test has been invoked
forceActivating(1) - The force activating test was the last test invoked on this port
loopTest(2) - The loop test was the last test invoked on this port
externalTest(3) - An external test was the last test invoked on this port
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnLineTestRequestStateLastInvokedTest

description: A bit-mask indicating which ifIndices the control request is to apply to.
The bit-mask is in the form of an Octet String of size 256 octets (2048 bits).
Each bit represents a value of an ifIndex in the range 0..2047 beginning from
bit 0 in Octet 1 (ifIndex=0) to bit 7 in Octet 256 (ifIndex=2047).
The octet for a given ifIndex is given by use of integer division as follows:
The bit number within the octet calculated above is then given by
Valid values for ifIndex (and corresponding bits) depends on
- number of slots supported by the NE
- which slots (IU cards) are applicable to the control request
- the number of supported ports on the card.
For ISDN cards with 32 ports, only the following ifIndex values would be valid:
variables.name: SHE-ISDN-MIB::sheIsdnPortConfigControlIfindexBitMask

description: A bit-mask indicating which ifIndices the control request is to apply to.
The bit-mask is in the form of an Octet String of size 256 octets (2048 bits).
Each bit represents a value of an ifIndex in the range 0..2047 beginning from
bit 0 in Octet 1 (ifIndex=0) to bit 7 in Octet 256 (ifIndex=2047).
The octet for a given ifIndex is given by use of integer division as follows:
The bit number within the octet calculated above is then given by
Valid values for ifIndex (and corresponding bits) depends on
- number of slots supported by the NE
- which slots (IU cards) are applicable to the control request
- the number of supported ports on the card.
For ISDN cards with 32 ports, only the following ifIndex values would be valid:
